tool.name: mQC
tool.description: quality control of ribosome profiling mapping results
tool.command:
mQC.pl --galaxy Y --galaxytest $galaxytest --experiment_name $exp_name --cores $cores --species $species --ens_v $ensv --unique $uniq --mapper $mapper --maxmultimap $maxmultimap --ens_db "get" --offset $offsetSelect.offset --min_length_gd $min_l_gd --max_length_gd $max_l_gd --plotrpftool $plotrpftool --outhtml $MappingQC_output --outfolder $MappingQC_output.files_path
#if $inputtypeSelect.inputtype == "sam" --samfile '$inputtypeSelect.samfile' --galaxysam Y #else if $inputtypeSelect.inputtype == "bam" --samfile '$inputtypeSelect.bamfile' --galaxysam N #end if #if $offsetSelect.offset == "from_file" --offset_file $offsetSelect.offsetFile #else if $offsetSelect.offset == "plastid" #if $inputtypeSelect.inputtype == "sam" --plastid_bam "convert" #else if $inputtypeSelect.inputtype == "bam" --plastid_bam $inputtypeSelect.bamfile #end if --min_length_plastid $offsetSelect.min_l_plastid --max_length_plastid $offsetSelect.max_l_plastid #end if

param.name: inputtype
param.label: Select the format of your input data

param.name: samfile
param.label: Choose the sam file on which you want to do quality control

param.name: bamfile
param.label: Choose the bam file on which you want to do quality control

param.name: cores
param.label: Enter the number of cores to run the mapping quality control

param.name: uniq
param.label: Perform mQC with unique mapped reads only

param.name: plotrpftool
param.label: Choose the style of the RPF phase plot
param.option: 3D bar chart (may suffer from Escher effects)

param.name: mapper
param.label: Which mapper is used to generate your SAM file?

param.name: maxmultimap
param.label: Only use alignments that mapped fewer times than this value

param.name: min_l_gd
param.label: Enter the minimum RPF length for gene distribution construction

param.name: max_l_gd
param.label: Enter the maximum RPF length for gene distribution construction

param.name: offset
param.label: The way P-site offsets were determined

param.name: offsetFile
param.label: Choose a text file with the offsets. Each line should be structured as RPF length - offset, seperated by a tab or a space

param.name: min_l_plastid
param.label: Enter the minimum RPF length for plastid offset calculation

param.name: max_l_plastid
param.label: Enter the maximum RPF length for plastid offset calculation

tool.help:
.. class:: infomark
**What it does**
MappingQC is a tool to easily generate some figures which give a nice overview of the quality of the mapping of ribosome profiling data. More specific, it gives an overview of the P site offset calculation, the gene distribution and the metagenic classification. Furthermore, MappingQC does a thorough analysis of the triplet periodicity and the linked triplet phase (typical for ribosome profiling) in the canonical transcript of your data. Especially, the link between the phase distribution and the RPF length, the relative sequence position and the triplet identity are taken into account.
There is also a version from MappingQC available, which is directly linked to PROTEOFORMER and its SQLite results database structure. This makes its usage in combination with PROTEOFORMER more straight forward and can speed up the total analysis process.
-----
.. class:: infomark
**Input**
1) SAM file with mapping results
2) Ensembl DB with annotation for the selected species and Ensembl version
------
.. class:: infomark
**Output**
1) HTML file: overview file of the tables and figures. Main output of MappingQC
2) ZIP file: contains a folder with all necessary figures. In this folder you can also find the overview HTML file.
